models.name: Male Reproductive System
models.description: Complete male reproductive anatomy with testes, epididymis, vas deferens, prostate, seminal vesicles, and external genitalia
models.educational_value: Understand male reproductive anatomy and sperm production

models.name: Female Reproductive System
models.description: Complete female reproductive anatomy with ovaries, fallopian tubes, uterus, vagina, and external genitalia
models.educational_value: Understand female reproductive anatomy and egg production

models.name: Flower Reproduction and Pollination
models.description: Plant reproductive system showing flower structure, stamens, pistil, pollen grains, and pollination process
models.educational_value: Understand plant reproductive strategies and pollination mechanisms

models.name: Fetal Development Stages
models.description: Embryonic and fetal development from conception through three trimesters
models.nigerian_context: Prenatal care understanding for health education
models.educational_value: Understand human development and importance of maternal health

models.name: Gamete Formation (Spermatogenesis & Oogenesis)
models.description: Comparative study of sperm and egg production showing meiosis processes
models.educational_value: Understand meiosis and the formation of gametes

models.name: Menstrual Cycle Phases
models.description: Complete 28-day menstrual cycle with menstrual, follicular, ovulation, and luteal phases
models.nigerian_context: Health education - Understanding female reproductive health
models.educational_value: Understand hormonal regulation of reproductive cycles

cultural_sensitivity_notes: All models presented with scientific accuracy and cultural appropriateness for Nigerian secondary education. Emphasis on biological processes and health understanding rather than explicit content.
